etymologies: modern Latin, named after Michel Sarrazin (died 1734), Canadian botanist

definitions: a North American pitcher plant of marshy places, some kinds of which are cultivated as ornamentals.

notes.text: Genus Sarracenia, family Sarraceniaceae: several species, including the purple-flowered S. purpurea, which has become naturalized in Ireland

shortDefinitions: North American pitcher plant of marshy places
